title: Judge Allows Lawsuits Challenging Georgia’s Voting Rules to Move Forward
sub_head: Court denies state’s motions to dismiss legal challenges by Justice Department, civil rights groups
body:
A federal judge on Thursday rejected requests by Georgia to throw out lawsuits challenging Republican-backed changes to the state’s voting rules, clearing the cases to move forward.
U.S. District Judge J.P. Boulee in Atlanta said the lawsuits make plausible claims that Georgia’s new procedures violate federal law, including by discriminating against minority voters. The judge, a Trump appointee, wasn’t considering the merits of the allegations, only whether they were sufficient for the cases to move to trial.
